description: Alice Smith is a classically trained chef who has worked in some of the world's top restaurants. She is known for her expertise in French cuisine and her attention to detail in every dish she creates.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pan, reserving drippings. Add chicken to drippings in pan; cook 10 minutes or until browned, turning occasionally. Remove chicken from pan; keep warm. Add onion to pan; cook 8 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Add mushrooms; cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in flour; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add wine, thyme, and garlic, scraping pan to loosen browned bits. Return bacon and chicken to pan; bring to a simmer. Cover and simmer 45 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve over noodles or mashed potatoes.

1. Cut beef into thin strips. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef; cook 5 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove beef from pan; keep warm. Add onion and mushrooms to pan; cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic; cook 1 minute. Return beef to pan. Combine sour cream and flour in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Add sour cream mixture to pan; bring to a simmer. Cook 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve over cooked egg noodles.

1. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook 5 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove chicken from pan; keep warm. Add onion to pan; cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and curry powder; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Return chicken to pan. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve over cooked basmati rice.

description: Bob Lee is a self-taught chef who has a passion for fusion cuisine. He has traveled the world to learn about different ingredients and techniques, and his dishes reflect his love of experimenting with bold flavors.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell peppers, and carrots; cook 5 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, beans, corn, and chili powder; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.

1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell peppers, and carrots; cook 5 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, beans, corn, and chili powder; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.

1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Rub salmon with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Grill salmon for 5-7 minutesor until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove chicken from pan; keep warm. Add onion to pan; cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and curry powder; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Return chicken to pan. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve over cooked basmati rice.

description: Maria Rodriguez is a chef who specializes in Latin American cuisine. She grew up in a family of chefs and learned to cook from her mother and grandmother. She is known for her use of fresh ingredients and bold flavors in her dishes.
